intro: Schismus inermis, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are often pink or red in color. Schismus inermis is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water requirements.
